intro: Schiedea mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. It has a rosette-forming structure with thick, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. Schiedea mexicana is a rare and endangered species, with limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
